channel.title: Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser
channel.description:
[url=http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lynx_(web_browser)]Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser[/url]
It actually looks pretty easy to use. From a command line, it must be very easy to use. It's supposed to be popular among Linux distros, but I never used it. I've heard a few good things about it while on MSN the other day, when I asked a few people.
It's probably in synaptic if you have that installed.
Lynx for Linux - http://lynx.isc.org/current/index.html Lynx for Windows - http://csant.info/downloads/lynx_setup-2.8.5rel-1.zip
~Ron :)

item.source: Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser

item.title: Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Mr.Chris:

Ron, it’s probably 1 or two seconds faster. when you’re searching for some information, it probably knocks 10 seconds off of the search. Hey, with those 10 seconds I could…Oh wait, I could stand up then sit down again. Not noly that, but with this browser I don’t see images!? Images make the Internet a whole lot less boring.

I typically do not like seeing images. I’m not a huge fan of GUI even though I like to make forms in scar. And like I said, if I wanted to see pictures, I can always use Firefox, but if I just wanted information and I wanted it fast like for school then I would use Lynx.

I would especially use Lynx because the country I am in right now (that I’m visiting) has evil ISPs that force a 1 GB download cap. If I go over that, they charge my Aunt exponentially and she gets pissed!

Read full topic

item.source: Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser

item.title: Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

It’s not just that Krypton. I was reading more and more about it, and loading pages in it is lightning fast. Such as… click on a link and it’s suddenly there.

If I wanted to play games or watch videos or play around with javascript then I would use Firefox, but if I just wanted to search the web, I’d rather use something small, simple, and text only. I can block ads in Firefox as well as images. But even then it loads arbitrary things like CSS or things that I don’t even know about lol.

With just a text based browser all you see is the real meat of the website. The information.

Read full topic
item.source: Anyone use Lynx - Text Based Browser

I may just use this instead of Firefox. :eek:
